page.title: 16LORD ELLIOTT OF MORPETH
page.content: Lord Elliott lives at{Lipwood Hall.}He writes of it: "It is a happy place with its Georgian facade,its walled garden,its meadows which abound in summertime with herbs & old grasses. I love the trees of Lipwood,central of which is a copper beech,magnificent at this time in its summer foliage.Lipwood charms,soothes it smiles for me each time I return from London.It was my privilege for some years to serve in the{House of {Commons}as an M.P.This stemmed from an inborn interest in public affairs, and a desire to be involved in them.It was so good to serve{Newcastle-upon-Tyne to know its people,its problems,its institutions & to take some part in its modern development.Now,as a Member of the{House of Lords,}my service continues & I shall do my best to justify the confidence placed in me."
